intro: Hesperomeles chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí huito, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its deciduous nature, shedding its leaves seasonally. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible fruits resembling small apples. Its botanical features include simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges and a woody stem that can grow up to several meters in height. Hesperomeles chiriquensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
